intro: Streptostachys rigidifolia, commonly known as the rigid-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has a woody stem and produces capsule-like fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance to aid in attachment to host plants. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in forest canopies. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly impact the health of its host trees if left unchecked.
